definition: to win an honor/to strive to win a prize
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: Gain many prizes for nation. Children all over the world will watch my cartoons.
sentences.chinese: 拿大獎，爲國爭光，讓全世界小孩都看我的動畫片。

sentences.english: The desire to win glory for their country impels the athletes to train diligently.
sentences.chinese: 爲國爭光的志願激勵運動員刻苦訓練。

sentences.english: But the Beijing Olympics has made people willing to contribute to the nation's glory.
sentences.chinese: 但是北京奧運會使人們願意爲國爭光做貢獻。

sentences.english: Competitive gymnastics is the accented of "Program of Striving for Olympic Glory".
sentences.chinese: 競技體操是我國“奧運爭光計劃”的一個重點項目。

sentences.english: Her goal is to become a star athlete and make China proud.
sentences.chinese: 她的目標是成爲一名體育明星，爲國爭光。

sentences.english: Every cager must attain good results snd win honour for the country.
sentences.chinese: 每個籃球隊員必須創造好成績，爲國爭光。

sentences.english: So few athletes have this chance to play in the Olympics for their country.
sentences.chinese: 沒幾個運動員有這種在奧運賽場上爲國爭光的機會。

sentences.english: I want to become a star athlete and make China proud.
sentences.chinese: 我想成爲一個體育明星，爲國爭光。

sentences.english: Thomas could be a credit to the school in any station of life.
sentences.chinese: 托馬斯不論在哪個崗位上，都能爲校爭光。

sentences.english: For now, the target for Haier is to create world famous brand and win honour for our country.
sentences.chinese: 當前，海爾的目標是創中國的世界名牌，爲民族爭光。

sentences.english: I love the collective, collective activities, winning glory for the classes.
sentences.chinese: 我熱愛集體，在集體活動中，爲班級爭光。

sentences.english: Other internet users urged him to continue with his efforts to "win glory for our country."
sentences.chinese: 其他的一些網友則鼓勵他繼續努力“爲國爭光”。

sentences.english: Lola and Keiko take every opportunity to stand tall for America.
sentences.chinese: 羅拉和凱克爭取一切機會爲美利堅爭光。

sentences.english: His contributions to science do honor to our country.
sentences.chinese: 他在科學上的貢獻爲我們國家爭光。
